intro: Racosperma varium, commonly known as the variable acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features bipinnate leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are typically yellow or golden in color, arranged in dense, cylindrical spikes. Racosperma varium is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
